subject: Real Estate
subcategory: Famous Properties That Changed the World
title: The Factory: Warhol's Creative Real Estate
description: A fast breakdown of The Factory: Warhol's Creative Real Estate for builders.

hook.text: Andy Warhol rented a Manhattan loft for almost nothing and turned it into the center of American pop art.

buildup.text: The Factory attracted musicians, actors, and artists. It was a studio, party venue, and cultural laboratory.

discovery.text: Warhol's presence transformed the neighborhood. Rents in the surrounding blocks climbed steadily for years.

twist.text: When Warhol died in 1987, his estate was valued at $220 million â€” mostly art, not real estate.

climax.text: The Factory proved that a single creative tenant can gentrify a neighborhood faster than any developer.

punchline.text: One artist's loft reshaped a whole neighborhood.

quiz.question: How did Warhol's Factory affect the surrounding area?
